titles: Proclamation for crying down the silver Scots crown-piece, and the fourty shilling, twenty shilling, ten shilling, and five shilling Scots pieces to their former rates.
author: Scotland. Privy Council.
Scotland. Sovereign (1694-1702 : William II)
publisher: Printed by the heirs and successors of Andrew Anderson, Printer to his most excellent Majesty,
notes: Royal arms at head of text; initial letter.
Dated: Given under Our Signet, at Edinburgh, the second day of June, and of Our Reign the eight year, 1696.
Signed: Gilb. Eliot, Cls. Sti. Concilii.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
keywords: Coinage --  Law and legislation --  Scotland --  Early works to 1800.
